lines.text: What the hell is happening?
I blew up the building.
Why?
Because you made a phone call.
Do they know me?
Who's them?
Do they know me?
I don't know what you're talking about.
You're either very smart... or incredibly stupid.
In guerrilla warfare, you try to use your weaknesses as strengths.
Such as?

Well, if they're big and you're small, then you're mobile and they're slow. You're hidden and they're exposed. You only fight battles you know you can win. That's the way the Vietcong did it. You capture their weapons and you use them against them the next time.
You're blowing my whole life.
What life? You live in a fucking jar so the world can't touch you. And Rachel, you didn't give a shit about Rachel. Just some package under seat number 32 to you.
[Brill punches Dean, who then points the gun at Brill]
Come on. Do you have a problem? Do it. Go on, do it.
I'm all you've got. And you're all I've got.
I'm sick of this, you either shoot me, or tell me what the fuck is going on!
You have something they want!
I don't have anything!
Maybe you do, but you don't know it! Stay off the phone. Stay away from me and Rachel, you come near any one of us, I'm gonna kill you.
Bob. We we're told to look back on your files as far as the electrician strike. We believe that you helped a man named Sam Velotti form a company called Zurich.
We also found out about your connection with the Peitzo family.
Well, that's true.
You're admitting to it?
Sure. Everything except forming a company called Zurich, or knowing anybody who is named Sam Velotti, or having any connection, whatsoever to the Peitzo family. This is Ridiculous.
Bob we're trying...

[Interrupting]
Wait, wait. This is Pintero, he's coming after me. You give me 1 week, 1 week and 4 people from litigation, and I can guarantee you, we can have this guy begging us...

[Interrupting]
Tell us abut Rachael Banks.
I'll tell you what. Rachael, was my girlfriend in my second year of law school, we still remain in close contact, and we swap information from time to time.
Did you have an affair with her 4 years ago?
Ever beat off in the shower, Brian? Ever had any homosexual thoughts?
Bob, that's...

[Interrupting]
None of my fuckin' business. You're damn right it's not. I love my wife and I love my son, "absolutely" with no equivocations, and that's none of your fuckin' business either.
Bob, we believe that you should take a leave of abscence on this, until we straighten this out.
Are you firing me?
I think you just fired yourself.

I want the entire history of this device, from birth to abortion on my desk in 2 hours. I want the name of the tech who made it. I want to know who authorized its use, who checked it out from inventory,
[hits the table]

And for what purpose? And most important, how in God's green earth it got into Congressman Albert's hotel room! Listen people, everyone knows where this is going. If this was a legit op, and I can't imagine how it could be, then so be it. But if this was someone's unilateral wet dream, then that someone is going to prison.

[on TV]
We knew that we had to monitor our enemies. We've also come to realise that we need to monitor the people who are monitoring them...
Well, who's gonna monitor the monitors of the monitors?
I wouldn't mind doing a little *monitoring* myself.
Yes, and you've got lots and lots of *monitoring* to do.
Are you guys talking about sex?

The government's been in bed with the entire telecommunications industry since the forties. They've infected everything. They get into your bank statements, computer files, email, listen to your phone calls... Every wire, every airwave. The more technology used, the easier it is for them to keep tabs on you. It's a brave new world out there. At least it'd better be.
So, who won the fight?
This is your dad, Eric. You know, when I put my foot down, that's it.
My mom won.

We never dealt with domestic. With us, it was always war. We won the war. Now we're fighting the peace. It's a lot more volatile. Now we've got ten million crackpots out there with sniper scopes, sarin gas and C-4. Ten-year-olds go on the Net, downloading encryption we can barely break, not to mention instructions on how to make a low-yield nuclear device. Privacy's been dead for years because we can't risk it. The only privacy that's left is the inside of your head. Maybe that's enough. You think we're the enemy of democracy, you and I? I think we're democracy's last hope.
[Watching a surveillance tape with Congressman Albert having sex with his female assistant]
I think you're a little young to watch this part.
Yeah, so's she.
What? That's my best aloha shirt.
Yeah, well say "aloha" to it.
*Please* let me follow the nanny. She doesn't shave her legs. Women like that are so... HOT.
Actually, I believe the term "shyster" is reserved for attorneys of the Jewish persuasion. I believe the proper term for me is "eggplant".
You're the only woman for me. You and Janet Jackson.
If you live another day I will be very impressed.
[last lines]

How do we draw the line - draw the line between protection of national security, obviously the government's need to obtain intelligence data, and the protection of civil liberties, particularly the sanctity of my home? You've got no right to come into my home!
Hello?

[calling from a payphone]
Carla, don't hang up.
Robert, you know what I'm looking at? Pictures of you and Rachel taken today.
Where did you get those photographs?
My messager Robert, my messager.
Listen honey, I think something's going on and I'm...
Robert, I went to the store today, and my money and credit cards didn't work. I couldn't buy food.

[looking at Brill, who mouths "Fuck you" to Robert]
Yeah, mine too. I gotta go.
What do you mean you gotta go?
I, I gotta go.
[hangs up]
You're the threat now. Just like I was.
Threat to whom? To them?
No. To your family, your friends, everybody you know, everybody you meet. That's why I went away and didn't come back. You've got to go away, Robert.
No, I don't think so. This is my life, I worked hard for it and I want it back. I grew up without a father, I know what that is. And I will not allow my family to go through that.

Telecommunications Security and Privacy Act. Invasion of privacy is more like it. - You read the Post? "This bill is not the first step towards the surveillance society. It is the surveillance society."

[talking to Brill]
So tell me what was on that tape.

[Watching from afar]
Your ugly-ass face, that's what.
I was shopping for some lingerie. That's still legal, isn't it?
Were you buying that for your wife?
No I was picking something up for myself, I do a little cross dressing on the weekends. You know, you'd be surprised how a nice pair of edible panties can make a guy feel sexy.
Wait a minute. Wait a minute. Listen. Now, we can go get a warrant and come back with the FBI, take anything we want, arrest anybody that we want. Just give the man the video tape!
Hey, the only one who's gonna get arrested here is YOU, for felonious COCK sucking with an attempt to swallow the evidence. So SHUT your mouth!
In your phone was a GPS sat-tracker. Pulses at 24 gigahertz.
I don't know what that means.
It's like a LoJack, only two generations better than what the police have.
And what does that mean?
You speak English?
Obviously not that well.
Kind of a jerk, aren't you?

Fort Meade has 18 acres of mainframe computers underground. You're talking to your wife on the phone and you use the word "bomb", "president", "Allah", any of a hundred keywords, the computer recognizes it, automatically records it, red-flags it for analysis. That was 20 years ago.
In the old days, we actually had to tap a wire into your phone line. Now with calls bouncing off satellites, they snatch'em right out of the air.
Now listen to me, you fuckin' eggplant, this videotape may save your clients's asses. But you can be goddamn sure it ain't gonna save yours. Now who made the fuckin' videotape?
I don't know.

[shrugging and raising his arms up]
How'd you get it?
Through an acquaintance.
I'm not gonna sit in congress and pass a law that lets the government point a camera and a microphone at anything they damn well please.
I'm not talking about campaign contributions, dammit, I'm talking about my constituents being out of work. Jesus man, wake up! National security isn't the only thing going on in this country!
Rachel F., for you-know-what, Banks. God, would I love to have her ruin my life.
Why are they after me?
I don't know and I don't wanna know
You're transmitting. They still got a signal on you. Get rid of your cloths all of them
Then what am I supposed to do?
Nothing. You live another day I'll be very impressed. You have something they want.
Look, I don't have anything
Maybe you do and you don't know it
Fuck a duck.
We believe Mr. Zavitz may have passed sensitive materials to you.
What sort of materials?
Sensitive, sir.
I have been a law abiding citizen my whole life, and one day with you, I'm shooting... and breaking...
Planning a quick getaway?
Yeah. Ever since I met you.
I need sugar. I'm getting cranky.
Getting?
You wanna take a poke at me?
I don't hit senior citizens.
Jones, Krug, what, are you guys from Communications?
No, we're Ops.
You can tell by their haircuts.
What will it take for us to walk out of here with that video tape?
The end of the world.
How do you like the trout?
It tastes like fish.
It is fish.
Yeah, but it tastes like every other fish I've ever eaten.
Yeah, go for it Mr. Congressman.
I missed you too, Dad. Where did you go?
Oh, they've been keeping me really busy on this case. They're trying to work me to death out there.

[to Dean, after he has just finished trying to blackmail him with incriminating evidence]
Listen to me, I want to know who made that videotape, and I want to know within a week... or I'll kill you.
You're either incredibly smart or incredibly stupid.
We'll see in a minute. Watch out for the FBI.
[winks to Brill]
He said his name was Brill.
He said it, or you said it and he picked up on it?

[pause]
Oh shit, I said it.
Ooh, sensitive.
Get in the fucking elevator.
You're transmitting. Get rid of your watch.
My wife gave me this watch.
Then keep it.
Hey, I'll be back to get my blender.
Yeah, I'll have it gift-wrapped.
You were right, I was wrong, but this is not the time for the 'I told you so' speech.
Oh, well there goes the Fourth Amendment... what's left of it.
Are you blackmailing me, you ambitious shit?
Baby, listen to this fascist gasbag.
Conspiracy theorists of the world unite.
It's more than a theory with me. I'm a former conspirer.

[while reading the newspaper]
Robert, how could you let me find out like this?
Honey, *I* found out like this. These are all lies, okay, none of this stuff is true.
Did you see her?
Yes, we had lunch together, she is the contact for the investigator, Brill. You're right about this, they got this from the security camera from the restaurant.
I thought you said she's not an issue.
She's not, I have to see her for business.
They said you had an affair with her, Robert. An affair. We went to marriage counseling for a year, and now, you're standing here lying about seeing her, you make me sick.
Carla, I am "smeared" all over the newspaper today for money-laundering schemes, mob ties, I lost my job. I am telling you, I am telling you is, trust me, on this Rachel Banks thing right now.
How in god's name can I trust you? Bobbie, I want you to leave.
Carla, I'm telling you, this is all bullshit!
I want you to leave, I cannot think with you in my face. I want you to leave!

[yelling over Carla]
Carla, how can you expect me to do this when you believe in this bullshit?
Just leave so I can think! Just go Bobbie, go! Go.
Steve? I thought you said his name was Bill.
No, *you're* Bill!
If I'm Bill, you're going to have to let me *know* that I'm Bill!
I just did.

[Robert Clayton Dean is buying lingerie]
What size?
What? Oh, my wife?
[a girl walks past, Dean watches and points at her]
A six?
Yeah, a six.
And what about cup size?
[she points at her own breasts]
Oh no, she's much bigger than that.
[the NSA team is watching satellite footage of a conversation between Dean and Brill on a rooftop]
Can you get a feature scan and pattern matching on him?
No, he's smart, he never looks up.
Why does he have to look up?
The satellite is 155 miles above the Earth. It can only look straight down.
That's a bit limited, isn't it?

[Sarcastically]
Well, maybe you should design a better one.
Maybe I will idiot.
[Carla is furious about the Privacy Bill being discussed on TV to Robert]
Don't you think you should be taking this a little more seriously?
Honey, I think you're taking it seriously enough for both of us, and half the block.
[Krug is spray painting graffiti in Dean's house to make it look like a break in]

[Watching him]
Lower! Lower! - like kids would do it, dammit!

[Angry]
You sound like a fucking old lady, shut up!
[Selby and Williams watch through the surveillance cameras]
Ooh, sensitive...!
Alright, Jones has some issues we need to resolve!
Goddamn... you son of a bitch!
[Dean and Brill were trying to make Reynolds confess, but they were captured by him]

[to Dean]
Asshole!
Great plan!
Baby, I love you and only you. That is it... And I love your family... except for your dad.
Hammersly was professionally wasted under the direction of some anal-retentive with what looks like a serious vitamin D deficiency.
[first lines]
Come on. Come on, mutt. Now, look at that ball. All right. Come on, get that ball. Ah!
The only person under arrest here is you! For felonious cock-sucking and attempting to swallow the evidence!

[while ransacking the Dean home]
Ooh, nice blender!
[takes Robert's blender]

[smiling]
Huh, not too stupid after all.

[Watching himself on TV and realizing it's a video Brill has sent him]
Brill you are one SICK man.
[an image of a wave on the beach showing the words "Wish you were here" appears]
Yeah, me too.
[another image of Brill's legs near the waves appears]
Oo. You're gonna need a tan on those things!

[Pratt has Brill, who is disguised as a policeman, at gunpoint]
You're gonna shoot a policeman on the street? You wouldn't get a block.
